title: Hexslinger
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | Hexslingers use debilitating spells to assist their ranged attacks. They begin the game with a sling, some spells to support its use, a scroll of poison to keep foes at a distance, and a robe. |

**Hexslingers** are ranged combat specialists who complement their attacks with debilitating [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes").

## Contents

- [1 Preferred Species](#Preferred_Species)
- [2 Racial Restrictions](#Racial_Restrictions)
- [3 Starting Equipment](#Starting_Equipment)
- [4 Starting Skills and Stats](#Starting_Skills_and_Stats)
- [5 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [5.1 Spell Details](#Spell_Details)
- [6 History](#History)

## Preferred Species

[Formicid](/Formicid "Formicid"), [Deep Elf](/Deep_Elf "Deep Elf"), [Kobold](/Kobold "Kobold"), [Spriggan](/Spriggan "Spriggan"), and [Gnoll](/Gnoll "Gnoll") are the recommended species if you pick a Hexslinger Background.

## Racial Restrictions

[Felids](/Felid "Felid") are forbidden from becoming Hexslingers, as they cannot use ranged weapons.

## Starting Equipment

Some [species](/Species "Species") may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

- +1 [sling](/Sling "Sling")
- +0 [robe](/Robe "Robe")
- [Scroll of poison](/Scroll_of_poison "Scroll of poison")

**Available Spells:**

- [Jinxbite](/Jinxbite "Jinxbite")
- [Sigil of Binding](/Sigil_of_Binding "Sigil of Binding")
- [Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame")
- [Dimensional Bullseye](/Dimensional_Bullseye "Dimensional Bullseye")
- [Cause Fear](/Cause_Fear "Cause Fear")

## Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' [aptitudes](/Aptitude "Aptitude").

- [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting"): 1
- [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons"): 2
- [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"): 2
- [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting"): 1
- [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes"): 3
- [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic"): 1

Choosing Hexslinger adds 5 to your starting [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") and 7 to your starting [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity").

## Strategy

Hexslingers are split between Ranged Weapons, Hexes, and defensive skills. Focus on weapon skill first, as your starting hexes can't kill enemies by themselves.

### Spell Details

[Jinxbite](/Jinxbite "Jinxbite") is a self-buff that allows you to deal extra damage and [drain](/Drain "Drain") enemies that fail to resist a [will](/Willpower "Willpower") check. However, it halves your willpower, so it's not recommended against monsters with dangerous hexes like [Paralyse](/Paralyse "Paralyse") or [Banishment](/Banishment "Banishment").

[Sigil of Binding](/Sigil_of_Binding "Sigil of Binding") creates sigils that prevent anyone who steps on them from moving. This is best used against melee enemies to keep them away from you, as it won't prevent ranged enemies or casters from acting.

[Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame") can be tricky to pull off without blowing yourself up, but is very effective against groups. It combos well with two other hexes: Sigil of Binding gives you space to avoid the explosion, while Dimensional Bullseye allows for creative sniping.

[Dimensional Bullseye](/Dimensional_Bullseye "Dimensional Bullseye") lets you attack the spell's target while attacking someone else simultaneously. Use this to pick off summoners and casters with smite-targeted spells you can't otherwise reach.

[Cause Fear](/Cause_Fear "Cause Fear") is both a great panic button and good offensive tool. It's an infinite use [scroll of fear](/Scroll_of_fear "Scroll of fear"), which is about as powerful as it sounds... though the scroll has a much higher chance of success. It doesn't work on undead or demons, but is effective in the [Lair](/Lair "Lair") and its non-Slime branches.

Look for [Blink](/Blink "Blink") and [Swiftness](/Swiftness "Swiftness") -- those are fantastic utilities for a ranged player throughout the entire game. Eventually, you'll also want to be able to cast other utility spells like [Metabolic Englaciation](/Metabolic_Englaciation "Metabolic Englaciation") or [Leda's Liquefaction](/Leda%27s_Liquefaction "Leda's Liquefaction"). You'll likely have a lot of experience left over, so pour it into [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting"), [Armour](/Armour "Armour")/[Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"), and [Stealth](/Stealth "Stealth").

## History

- In [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), Hexslingers were reworked. Prior to this version:

  - Hexslingers started with [Slow](/Slow "Slow"), [Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame"), [Portal Projectile](/Portal_Projectile "Portal Projectile"), and [Cause Fear](/Cause_Fear "Cause Fear").
  - Hexslingers gained +2 Str, +5 Int, and +5 Dex and did not start with any [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic").

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), this background was named **Arcane Marksman** (**AM**).

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), Arcane Marksmen started with a choice of [hunting sling](/Hunting_sling "Hunting sling"), [hand crossbow](/Hand_crossbow "Hand crossbow"), shortbow, or throwing weapons. Launchers were +0 and started with 20 of their respective [ammo](/Ammo "Ammo"), which they had to worry about. Throwing started with 6 [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") (adjusted for species) and 2 [throwing nets](/Throwing_net "Throwing net").
  - This version gave almost all backgrounds a consumable: AM now starts with a [scroll of poison](/Scroll_of_poison "Scroll of poison").

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Arcane Marksmen started with the [Corona](/Corona "Corona") spell memorized. [Slow](/Slow "Slow") was moved down to level 1 to compensate.

- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), Arcane Marksmen had the [Book of Debilitation](/Book_of_Debilitation "Book of Debilitation"), and started with [Leda's Liquefaction](/Leda%27s_Liquefaction "Leda's Liquefaction").

- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), the book of Debilitation had [Gell's Gravitas](/Gell%27s_Gravitas "Gell's Gravitas") instead of [Portal Projectile](/Portal_Projectile "Portal Projectile").

- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), [teleport control](/Control_Teleport "Control Teleport") combined with the [blink](/Blink "Blink") spell allowed for semi-controlled blinks which was super useful for kiting even fast enemies.

- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), Arcane Marksmen starting with javelins didn't get any throwing nets.

- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), Arcane Marksmen started with 2 levels of Spellcasting.

- In earlier versions of the game, ammunition for launchers was much less common in the early game. This required careful ammo management until supplies were found deeper in the dungeon. In addition, AM started with spells that [branded](/Brand "Brand") ammo, such as Poison Ammunition.
